Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311 Writ to take physical custody of child.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311(1): Upon the filing of a petition seeking enforcement of a child custody determination, the petitioner may file a verified application for the issuance of a writ of assistance to take physical custody of the child if the child is likely to suffer serious imminent physical harm or removal from this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311(2): 78B-13-308(2) If the court, upon the testimony of the petitioner or other witness, finds that the child is likely to suffer serious imminent physical harm or be imminently removed from this state, it may issue a writ of assistance to take physical custody of the child.  The petition shall be heard within 72 hours after the writ is executed.  The writ shall include the statements required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311(3): A writ to take physical custody of a child shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311(3)(a): recite the facts upon which a conclusion of serious imminent physical harm or removal from the jurisdiction is based;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311(3)(b): direct law enforcement officers to take physical custody of the child immediately; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311(3)(c): provide for the placement of the child pending final relief.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311(4): The respondent shall be served with the petition, writ, and order immediately after the child is taken into physical custody.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311(5): A writ of assistance to take physical custody of a child is enforceable throughout this state.  If the court finds on the basis of the testimony of the petitioner or other witness that a less intrusive remedy is not effective, it may authorize law enforcement officers to enter private property to take physical custody of the child.  If required by the exigency of the case, the court may authorize law enforcement officers to make a forcible entry at any hour.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-311(6): The court may impose conditions upon placement of a child to ensure the appearance of the child and the child's custodian.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-312 Costs, fees, and expenses.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-312(1): The court shall award the prevailing party, including a state, necessary and reasonable expenses incurred by or on behalf of the party, including costs, communication expenses, attorney fees, investigative fees, expenses for witnesses, travel expenses, and child care during the course of the proceedings, unless the party from whom fees or expenses are sought establishes that the award would be clearly inappropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-312(2): The court may not assess fees, costs, or expenses against a state except as otherwise provided by law other than this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-313 Recognition and enforcement.
-------------------------------------------------------------
A court of this state shall accord full faith and credit to an order made consistently with this chapter which enforces a child custody determination by a court of another state unless the order has been vacated, stayed, or modified by a court authorized to do so under

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-314 Appeals.
-----------------------------------------
An appeal may be taken from an order in a proceeding under this chapter in accordance with expedited appellate procedures in other civil cases.  Unless the court enters a temporary emergency order under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-315 Role of prosecutor or attorney general.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-315(1): In a case arising under this chapter or involving the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction, the prosecutor or Attorney General may take any lawful action, including resort to a proceeding under this chapter or any other available civil proceeding to locate a child, obtain the return of a child, or enforce a child custody determination if there is:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-315(1)(a): an existing child custody determination;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-315(1)(b): a request from a court in a pending child custody case;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-315(1)(c): a reasonable belief that a criminal statute has been violated; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-315(1)(d): a reasonable belief that the child has been wrongfully removed or retained in violation of the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-315(2): A prosecutor or attorney general acts on behalf of the court and may not represent any party to a child custody determination.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-316 Role of law enforcement.
---------------------------------------------------------
At the request of a prosecutor or the attorney general acting under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-317 Costs and expenses.
----------------------------------------------------
If the respondent is not the prevailing party, the court may assess against the respondent all direct expenses and costs incurred by the prosecutor or attorney general and law enforcement officers under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-13-318 Transitional provision.
--------------------------------------------------------
A motion or other request for relief made in a child custody or enforcement proceeding which was commenced before the effective date of this chapter is governed by the law in effect at the time the motion or other request was made.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 78B - Chapter 14 - Utah Uniform Interstate Family Support Act
*****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Utah Uniform Interstate Family Support Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(1): "Child" means an individual, whether over or under the age of majority, who is or is alleged to be owed a duty of support by the individual's parent or who is or is alleged to be the beneficiary of a support order directed to the parent.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(2): "Child support order" means a support order for a child, including a child who has attained the age of majority under the law of the issuing state or foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(3): "Convention" means the convention on the International Recovery of Child Support and Other Forms of Family Maintenance, concluded at The Hague on November 23, 2007.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(4): "Duty of support" means an obligation imposed or imposable by law to provide support for a child, spouse, or former spouse, including an unsatisfied obligation to provide support.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(5): 78B-14-308 "Foreign country" means a country, including a political subdivision thereof, other than the United States, that authorizes the issuance of support orders and:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(5)(a): which has been declared under the law of the United States to be a foreign reciprocating country;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(5)(b): 78B-14-308 which has established a reciprocal arrangement for child support with this state as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(5)(c): which has enacted a law or established procedures for the issuance and enforcement of support orders which are substantially similar to the procedures under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(5)(d): in which the convention is in force with respect to the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(6): "Foreign support order" means a support order of a foreign tribunal.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(7): "Foreign tribunal" means a court, administrative agency, or quasi-judicial entity of a foreign country which is authorized to establish, enforce, or modify support orders or to determine parentage of a child.  The term includes a competent authority under the convention.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(8): "Home state" means the state or foreign country in which a child lived with a parent or a person acting as parent for at least six consecutive months immediately preceding the time of filing of a petition or comparable pleading for support and, if a child is less than six months old, the state or foreign country in which the child lived from birth with any of them.  A period of temporary absence of any of them is counted as part of the six-month or other period.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(9): "Income" includes earnings or other periodic entitlements to money from any source and any other property subject to withholding for support under the law of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(10): 26B-9-101 "Income-withholding order" means an order or other legal process directed to an obligor's employer or other source of income as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(11): "Initiating tribunal" means the tribunal of a state or foreign country from which a petition or comparable pleading is forwarded or in which a petition or comparable pleading is filed for forwarding to another state or foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(12): "Issuing foreign country" means the foreign country in which a tribunal issues a support order or a judgment determining parentage of a child.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(13): "Issuing state" means the state in which a tribunal issues a support order or a judgment determining parentage of a child.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(14): "Issuing tribunal" means the tribunal of a state or foreign country that issues a support order or a judgment determining parentage of a child.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(15): "Law" includes decisional and statutory law and rules and regulations having the force of law.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(16): "Obligee" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(16)(a): an individual to whom a duty of support is or is alleged to be owed or in whose favor a support order or a judgment determining parentage of a child has been issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(16)(b): a foreign country, state, or political subdivision of a state to which the rights under a duty of support or support order have been assigned or which has independent claims based on financial assistance provided to an individual obligee in place of child support;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(16)(c): an individual seeking a judgment determining parentage of the individual's child; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(16)(d): a person who is a creditor in a proceeding under Part 7, Support Proceedings Under Convention.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(17): "Obligor" means an individual who, or the estate of a decedent that:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(17)(a): owes or is alleged to owe a duty of support;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(17)(b): is alleged but has not been adjudicated to be a parent of a child;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(17)(c): is liable under a support order; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(17)(d): is a debtor in a proceeding under Part 7, Support Proceedings Under Convention.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(18): "Outside this state" means a location in another state or a country other than the United States, whether or not the country is a foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(19): "Person" means an individual, corporation, business trust, estate, trust, partnership, limited liability company, association, joint venture, government, governmental subdivision, agency, or instrumentality, public corporation, or any other legal or commercial entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(20): "Record" means information that is inscribed on a tangible medium or that is stored in an electronic or other medium and is retrievable in perceivable form.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(21): "Register" means to file in a tribunal of this state a support order or judgment determining parentage of a child issued in another state or a foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(22): "Registering tribunal" means a tribunal in which a support order or judgment determining parentage of a child is registered.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(23): "Responding state" means a state in which a petition or comparable pleading for support or to determine parentage of a child is filed or to which a petition or comparable pleading is forwarded for filing from another state or a foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(24): "Responding tribunal" means the authorized tribunal in a responding state or foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(25): "Spousal support order" means a support order for a spouse or former spouse of the obligor.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(26): "State" means a state of the United States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the United States Virgin Islands, or any territory or insular possession subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.  The term includes an Indian nation or tribe.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(27): "Support enforcement agency" means a public official, governmental entity, or private agency authorized to:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(27)(a): seek enforcement of support orders or laws relating to the duty of support;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(27)(b): seek establishment or modification of child support;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(27)(c): request determination of parentage of a child;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(27)(d): attempt to locate obligors or their assets; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(27)(e): request determination of the controlling child support order.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(28): "Support order" means a judgment, decree, order, decision, or directive, whether temporary, final, or subject to modification, issued in a state or foreign country for the benefit of a child, a spouse, or a former spouse, which provides for monetary support, health care, arrearages, retroactive support, or reimbursement for financial assistance provided to an individual obligee in place of child support.  The term may include related costs and fees, interest, income withholding, automatic adjustment, reasonable attorney fees, and other relief.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-102(29): "Tribunal" means a court, administrative agency, or quasi-judicial entity authorized to establish, enforce, or modify support orders or to determine parentage of a child.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-103 State tribunal and support enforcement agency.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-103(1): The district court and the Utah Department of Health and Human Services are the tribunals of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-103(2): The Utah Department of Health and Human Services is the state support enforcement agency.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-104 Remedies cumulative.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-104(1): Remedies provided by this chapter are cumulative and do not affect the availability of remedies under other law or the recognition of a foreign support order on the basis of comity.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-104(2): This chapter does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-104(2)(a): provide the exclusive method of establishing or enforcing a support order under the law of this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-104(2)(b): grant a tribunal of this state jurisdiction to render judgment or issue an order relating to child custody or parent-time in a proceeding under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-105 Application of chapter to residents of foreign countries and foreign support proceedings.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-105(1): Part 1, General Provisions; Part 2, Jurisdiction; Part 3, Civil Provisions of General Application; Part 4, Establishment of Support Order or Determination of Parentage; Part 5, Enforcement of Support Order Without Registration; Part 6, Registration, Enforcement, and Modification of Support Order; Part 7, Support Proceedings Under Convention A tribunal of this state shall apply
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-105(1)(a): a foreign support order;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-105(1)(b): a foreign tribunal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-105(1)(c): an obligee, obligor, or child residing in a foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-105(2): Part 1, General Provisions; Part 2, Jurisdiction; Part 3, Civil Provisions of General Application; Part 4, Establishment of Support Order or Determination of Parentage; Part 5, Enforcement of Support Order Without Registration; Part 6, Registration, Enforcement, and Modification of Support Order A tribunal of this state that is requested to recognize and enforce a support order on the basis of comity may apply the procedural and substantive provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-105(3): Part 7, Support Proceedings Under Convention; Part 7, Support Proceedings Under Convention; Part 1, General Provisions; Part 2, Jurisdiction; Part 3, Civil Provisions of General Application; Part 4, Establishment of Support Order or Determination of Parentage; Part 5, Enforcement of Support Order Without Registration; Part 6, Registration, Enforcement, and Modification of Support Order; Part 7, Support Proceedings Under Convention


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201 Bases for jurisdiction over nonresident.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(1): Title 78B, Chapter 6, Part 1, Utah Adoption Act In a proceeding to establish or enforce a support order or to determine parentage of a child, a tribunal of this state may exercise personal jurisdiction over a nonresident individual, or the individual's guardian or conservator, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(1)(a): the individual is personally served with notice within this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(1)(b): the individual submits to the jurisdiction of this state by consent in a record, by entering a general appearance, or by filing a responsive document having the effect of waiving any contest to personal jurisdiction;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(1)(c): the individual resided with the child in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(1)(d): the individual resided in this state and provided prenatal expenses or support for the child;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(1)(e): the child resides in this state as a result of the acts or directives of the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(1)(f): the individual engaged in sexual intercourse in this state and the child may have been conceived by that act of intercourse;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(1)(g): Title 78B, Chapter 6, Part 1, Utah Adoption Act the individual asserted parentage of a child in the putative father registry maintained in this state by the state registrar of vital records in the Department of Health pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(1)(h): there is any other basis consistent with the constitutions of this state and the United States for the exercise of personal jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-201(2): (1); 78B-14-611; 78B-14-615 The bases of personal jurisdiction set forth in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-202 Duration of personal jurisdiction.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Personal jurisdiction acquired by a tribunal of this state in a proceeding under this chapter or other law of this state relating to a support order continues as long as a tribunal of this state has continuing, exclusive jurisdiction to modify its order or continuing jurisdiction to enforce its order as provided by Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-203 Initiating and responding tribunal of state.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Under this chapter, a tribunal of this state may serve as an initiating tribunal to forward proceedings to a tribunal of another state and as a responding tribunal for proceedings initiated in another state or a foreign country.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-204 Simultaneous proceedings in another state.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-204(1): A tribunal of this state may exercise jurisdiction to establish a support order if the petition or comparable pleading is filed after a pleading is filed in another state or a foreign country only if:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-204(1)(a): the petition or comparable pleading in this state is filed before the expiration of the time allowed in the other state or the foreign country for filing a responsive pleading challenging the exercise of jurisdiction by the other state or the foreign country;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-204(1)(b): the contesting party timely challenges the exercise of jurisdiction in the other state or the foreign country; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-204(1)(c): if relevant, this state is the home state of the child.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-204(2): A tribunal of this state may not exercise jurisdiction to establish a support order if the petition or comparable pleading is filed before a petition or comparable pleading is filed in another state or a foreign country if:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-204(2)(a): the petition or comparable pleading in the other state or foreign country is filed before the expiration of the time allowed in this state for filing a responsive pleading challenging the exercise of jurisdiction by this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-204(2)(b): the contesting party timely challenges the exercise of jurisdiction in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-204(2)(c): if relevant, the other state or foreign country is the home of the child.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205 Continuing, exclusive jurisdiction to modify child support order.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205(1): A tribunal of this state that has issued a child support order consistent with the law of this state has and shall exercise continuing, exclusive jurisdiction to modify its child support order if the order is the controlling order, and:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205(1)(a): at the time of the filing of a request for modification, this state is the residence of the obligor, the individual obligee, or the child for whose benefit the support order is issued; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205(1)(b): even if this state is not the residence of the obligor, the individual obligee, or the child for whose benefit the support order is issued, the parties consent in a record or in open court that the tribunal of this state may continue to exercise jurisdiction to modify its order.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205(2): A tribunal of this state that has issued a child support order consistent with the law of this state may not exercise continuing, exclusive jurisdiction to modify the order if:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205(2)(a): all of the parties who are individuals file consent in a record with the tribunal of this state that a tribunal of another state that has jurisdiction over at least one of the parties who is an individual or that is located in the state of residence of the child may modify the order and assume continuing, exclusive jurisdiction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205(2)(b): its order is not the controlling order.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205(3): If a tribunal of another state has issued a child support order pursuant to the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act or a law substantially similar to the act, which modifies a child support order of a tribunal of this state, tribunals of this state shall recognize the continuing, exclusive jurisdiction of the tribunal of the other state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205(4): A tribunal of this state that lacks continuing, exclusive jurisdiction to modify a child support order may serve as an initiating tribunal to request a tribunal of another state to modify a support order issued in that state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-205(5): A temporary support order issued ex parte or pending resolution of a jurisdictional conflict does not create continuing, exclusive jurisdiction in the issuing tribunal.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-206 Continuing jurisdiction to enforce child support order.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-206(1): A tribunal of this state that has issued a child support order consistent with the law of this state may serve as an initiating tribunal to request a tribunal of another state to enforce:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-206(1)(a): the order if the order is the controlling order and has not been modified by a tribunal of another state that assumed jurisdiction pursuant to the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-206(1)(b): a money judgment for arrears of support and interest on the order accrued before a determination that an order of a tribunal of another state is the controlling order.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-206(2): A tribunal of this state having continuing jurisdiction over a support order may act as a responding tribunal to enforce the order.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207 Determination of controlling child-support order.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(1): If a proceeding is brought under this chapter and only one tribunal has issued a child support order, the order of that tribunal controls and shall be so recognized.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(2): If a proceeding is brought under this chapter, and two or more child support orders have been issued by tribunals of this state, another state, or a foreign country with regard to the same obligor and same child, a tribunal of this state having personal jurisdiction over both the obligor and individual obligee shall apply the following rules and by order shall determine which order controls and shall be recognized:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(2)(a): If only one of the tribunals would have continuing, exclusive jurisdiction under this chapter, the order of that tribunal controls.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(2)(b): If more than one of the tribunals would have continuing, exclusive jurisdiction under this chapter, an order issued by a tribunal in the current home state of the child controls, or if an order has not been issued in the current home state of the child, the order most recently issued controls.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(2)(c): If none of the tribunals would have continuing, exclusive jurisdiction under this chapter, the tribunal of this state shall issue a child support order, which controls.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(3): (2); Part 6, Registration, Enforcement, and Modification of Support Order If two or more child support orders have been issued for the same obligor and same child, upon request of a party who is an individual or that is a support enforcement agency, a tribunal of this state having personal jurisdiction over both the obligor and the obligee who is an individual shall determine which order controls under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(4): A request to determine which is the controlling order shall be accompanied by a copy of every child support order in effect and the applicable record of payments.  The requesting party shall give notice of the request to each party whose rights may be affected by the determination.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(5): (1); (2); (3); 78B-14-205; 78B-14-206 The tribunal that issued the controlling order under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(6): (2)(a); (b); (3); (2)(c); 78B-14-209 A tribunal of this state that determines by order which is the controlling order under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(6)(a): the basis upon which the tribunal made its determination;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(6)(b): the amount of prospective support, if any; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(6)(c): 78B-14-209 the total amount of consolidated arrears and accrued interest, if any, under all of the orders after all payments made are credited as provided by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(7): Within 30 days after issuance of an order determining which is the controlling order, the party obtaining the order shall file a certified copy of it in each tribunal that issued or registered an earlier order of child support.  A party or support enforcement agency obtaining the order that fails to file a certified copy is subject to appropriate sanctions by a tribunal in which the issue of failure to file arises.  The failure to file does not affect the validity or enforceability of the controlling order.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-207(8): An order that has been determined to be the controlling order, or a judgment for consolidated arrears of support and interest, if any, made pursuant to this section shall be recognized in proceedings under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-208 Child support orders for two or more obligees.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In responding to registrations or petitions for enforcement of two or more child support orders in effect at the same time with regard to the same obligor and different individual obligees, at least one of which was issued by a tribunal of another state or a foreign country, a tribunal of this state shall enforce those orders in the same manner as if the orders had been issued by a tribunal of this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-209 Credit for payments.
-----------------------------------------------------
A tribunal of this state shall credit amounts collected for a particular period pursuant to any child support order against the amounts owed for the same period under any other child support order for support of the same child issued by a tribunal of this or another state or foreign country.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-210 Application of chapter to nonresident subject to personal jurisdiction.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A tribunal of this state exercising personal jurisdiction over a nonresident in a proceeding under this chapter, under other law of this state relating to a support order, or recognizing a foreign support order may receive evidence from outside this state pursuant to Section

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-211 Continuing, exclusive jurisdiction to modify spousal support order.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-211(1): A tribunal of this state issuing a spousal support order consistent with the law of this state has continuing, exclusive jurisdiction to modify the spousal support order throughout the existence of the support obligation.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-211(2): A tribunal of this state may not modify a spousal support order issued by a tribunal of another state or foreign country having continuing, exclusive jurisdiction over that order under the law of that state or foreign country.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-211(3): A tribunal of this state that has continuing, exclusive jurisdiction over a spousal support order may serve as:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-211(3)(a): an initiating tribunal to request a tribunal of another state to enforce the spousal support order issued in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-211(3)(b): a responding tribunal to enforce or modify its own spousal support order.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-301 Proceedings under chapter.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-301(1): Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, this part applies to all proceedings under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-301(2): An individual petitioner or a support enforcement agency may initiate a proceeding authorized under this chapter by filing a petition in an initiating tribunal for forwarding to a responding tribunal or by filing a petition or a comparable pleading directly in a tribunal of another state or a foreign country which has or can obtain personal jurisdiction over the respondent.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-302 Action by minor parent.
--------------------------------------------------------
A minor parent, or a guardian or other legal representative of a minor parent, may maintain a proceeding on behalf of or for the benefit of the minor's child.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-303 Application of law of state.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, a responding tribunal of this state shall:Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-303(1): apply the procedural and substantive law generally applicable to similar proceedings originating in this state and may exercise all powers and provide all remedies available in those proceedings; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-303(2): determine the duty of support and the amount payable in accordance with the law and support guidelines of this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-304 Duties of initiating tribunal.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-304(1): Upon the filing of a petition authorized by this chapter, an initiating tribunal of this state shall forward the petition and its accompanying documents:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-304(1)(a): to the responding tribunal or appropriate support enforcement agency in the responding state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-304(1)(b): if the identity of the responding tribunal is unknown, to the state information agency of the responding state with a request that they be forwarded to the appropriate tribunal and that receipt be acknowledged.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-304(2): If requested by the responding tribunal, a tribunal of this state shall issue a certificate or other document and make findings required by the law of the responding state.  If the responding tribunal is in a foreign country, upon request, the tribunal of this state shall specify the amount of support sought, convert that amount into the equivalent amount in the foreign currency under applicable official or market exchange rate as publicly reported, and provide any other documents necessary to satisfy the requirements of the responding foreign tribunal.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305 Duties and powers of responding tribunal.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(1): 78B-14-301(2) When a responding tribunal of this state receives a petition or comparable pleading from an initiating tribunal or directly pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2): A responding tribunal of this state, to the extent not prohibited by other law, may do one or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(a): establish or enforce a support order, modify a child support order, determine the controlling child support order, or determine parentage of a child;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(b): order an obligor to comply with a support order, specifying the amount and the manner of compliance;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(c): order income withholding;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(d): determine the amount of any arrearages and specify a method of payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(e): enforce orders by civil or criminal contempt, or both;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(f): set aside property for satisfaction of the support order;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(g): place liens and order execution on the obligor's property;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(h): order an obligor to keep the tribunal informed of the obligor's current residential address, electronic mail address, telephone number, employer, address of employment, and telephone number at the place of employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(i): issue a bench warrant for an obligor who has failed after proper notice to appear at a hearing ordered by the tribunal and enter the bench warrant in any local and state computer systems for criminal warrants;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(j): order the obligor to seek appropriate employment by specified methods;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(k): award reasonable attorney fees and other fees and costs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(2)(l): grant any other available remedy.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(3): A responding tribunal of this state shall include in a support order issued under this chapter, or in the documents accompanying the order, the calculations on which the support order is based.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(4): A responding tribunal of this state may not condition the payment of a support order issued under this chapter upon compliance by a party with provisions for parent-time.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(5): If a responding tribunal of this state issues an order under this chapter, the tribunal shall send a copy of the order to the petitioner and the respondent and to the initiating tribunal, if any.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-305(6): If requested to enforce a support order, arrears, or judgment or modify a support order stated in a foreign currency, a responding tribunal of this state shall convert the amount stated in the foreign currency to the equivalent amount in dollars under the applicable official or market exchange rate as publicly reported.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-306 Inappropriate tribunal.
--------------------------------------------------------
If a petition or comparable pleading is received by an inappropriate tribunal of this state, the tribunal shall forward the pleading and accompanying documents to an appropriate tribunal in this state or another state and notify the petitioner where and when the pleading was sent.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307 Duties of support enforcement agency.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(1): A support enforcement agency of this state, upon request, shall provide services to a petitioner in a proceeding under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(2): A support enforcement agency of this state that is providing services to the petitioner shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(2)(a): take all steps necessary to enable an appropriate tribunal of this state, another state, or a foreign country to obtain jurisdiction over the respondent;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(2)(b): request an appropriate tribunal to set a date, time, and place for a hearing;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(2)(c): make a reasonable effort to obtain all relevant information, including information as to income and property of the parties;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(2)(d): within 10 days, exclusive of Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays, after receipt of notice in a record from an initiating, responding, or registering tribunal, send a copy of the notice to the petitioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(2)(e): within 10 days, exclusive of Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays, after receipt of communication in a record from the respondent or the respondent's attorney, send a copy of the communication to the petitioner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(2)(f): notify the petitioner if jurisdiction over the respondent cannot be obtained.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(3): A support enforcement agency of this state that requests registration of a child support order in this state for enforcement or for modification shall make reasonable efforts:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(3)(a): to ensure that the order to be registered is the controlling order; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(3)(b): if two or more child support orders exist and the identity of the controlling order has not been determined, to ensure that a request for such a determination is made in a tribunal having jurisdiction to do so.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(4): A support enforcement agency of this state that requests registration and enforcement of a support order, arrears, or judgment stated in a foreign currency shall convert the amounts stated in the foreign currency into the equivalent amounts in dollars under the applicable official or market exchange rate as publicly reported.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(5): 78B-14-319 A support enforcement agency of this state shall issue or request a tribunal of this state to issue a child support order and an income-withholding order that redirects payment of current support, arrears, and interest if requested to do so by a support enforcement agency of another state pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-307(6): This chapter does not create or negate a relationship of attorney and client or other fiduciary relationship between a support enforcement agency or the attorney for the agency and the individual being assisted by the agency.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-308 Duty of attorney general.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-308(1): If the attorney general determines that the support enforcement agency is neglecting or refusing to provide services to an individual, the attorney general may order the agency to perform its duties under this chapter or may provide those services directly to the individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-308(2): The attorney general may determine that a foreign country has established a reciprocal arrangement for child support with this state and take appropriate action for notification of the determination.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-309 Private counsel.
-------------------------------------------------
An individual may employ private counsel to represent the individual in proceedings authorized by this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-310 Duties of state information agency.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-310(1): The Office of Recovery Services is the state information agency under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-310(2): The state information agency shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-310(2)(a): compile and maintain a current list, including addresses, of the tribunals in this state which have jurisdiction under this chapter and any support enforcement agencies in this state and transmit a copy to the state information agency of every other state;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-310(2)(b): maintain a register of names and addresses of tribunals and support enforcement agencies received from other states;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-310(2)(c): forward to the appropriate tribunal in the county in this state in which the obligee who is an individual or the obligor resides, or in which the obligor's property is believed to be located, all documents concerning a proceeding under this chapter received from another state or a foreign country; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-310(2)(d): obtain information concerning the location of the obligor and the obligor's property within this state not exempt from execution, by such means as postal verification and federal or state locator services, examination of telephone directories, requests for the obligor's address from employers, and examination of governmental records, including, to the extent not prohibited by law, those relating to real property, vital statistics, law enforcement, taxation, motor vehicles, driver licenses, and Social Security.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-311 Pleadings and accompanying documents.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-311(1): 78B-14-312 In a proceeding under this chapter, a petitioner seeking to establish a support order, to determine parentage of a child, or to register and modify a support order of a tribunal of another state or a foreign country shall file a petition.  Unless otherwise ordered under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-311(2): The petition shall specify the relief sought.  The petition and accompanying documents shall conform substantially with the requirements imposed by the forms mandated by federal law for use in cases filed by a support enforcement agency.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-312 Nondisclosure of information in exceptional circumstances.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a party alleges in an affidavit or a pleading under oath that the health, safety, or liberty of a party or child would be jeopardized by disclosure of specific identifying information, that information must be sealed and may not be disclosed to the other party or the public.  After a hearing in which a tribunal takes into consideration the health, safety, or liberty of the party or child, the tribunal may order disclosure of information that the tribunal determines to be in the interest of justice.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-313 Costs and fees.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-313(1): The petitioner may not be required to pay a filing fee or other costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-313(2): If an obligee prevails, a responding tribunal of this state may assess against an obligor filing fees, reasonable attorney fees, other costs, and necessary travel and other reasonable expenses incurred by the obligee and the obligee's witnesses.  The tribunal may not assess fees, costs, or expenses against the obligee or the support enforcement agency of either the initiating or the responding state or a foreign country, except as provided by law.  Attorney fees may be taxed as costs, and may be ordered paid directly to the attorney, who may enforce the order in the attorney's own name.  Payment of support owed to the obligee has priority over fees, costs, and expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-313(3): Part 6, Registration, Enforcement, and Modification of Support Order The tribunal shall order the payment of costs and reasonable attorney fees if it determines that a hearing was requested primarily for delay.  In a proceeding under


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-314 Limited immunity of petitioner.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-314(1): Participation by a petitioner in a proceeding under this chapter before a responding tribunal, whether in person, by private attorney, or through services provided by the support-enforcement agency, does not confer personal jurisdiction over the petitioner in another proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-314(2): A petitioner is not amenable to service of civil process while physically present in this state to participate in a proceeding under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-314(3): The immunity granted by this section does not extend to civil litigation based on acts unrelated to a proceeding under this chapter committed by a party while present in this state to participate in the proceeding.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-315 Nonparentage as defense.
---------------------------------------------------------
A party whose parentage of a child has been previously determined by or pursuant to law may not plead nonparentage as a defense to a proceeding under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316 Special rules of evidence and procedure.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(1): The physical presence of a nonresident party who is an individual in a tribunal of this state is not required for the establishment, enforcement, or modification of a support order or the rendition of a judgment determining parentage of a child.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(2): An affidavit, a document substantially complying with federally mandated forms, or a document incorporated by reference in any of them, which would not be excluded under the hearsay rule if given in person, is admissible in evidence if given under penalty of perjury by a party or witness residing outside this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(3): A copy of the record of child support payments certified as a true copy of the original by the custodian of the record may be forwarded to a responding tribunal.  The copy is evidence of facts asserted in it and is admissible to show whether payments were made.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(4): Copies of bills for testing for parentage of a child, and for prenatal and postnatal health care of the mother and child, furnished to the adverse party at least 10 days before trial, are admissible in evidence to prove the amount of the charges billed and that the charges were reasonable, necessary, and customary.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(5): Documentary evidence transmitted from outside this state to a tribunal of this state by telephone, telecopier, or other electronic means that do not provide an original record may not be excluded from evidence on an objection based on the means of transmission.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(6): In a proceeding under this chapter, a tribunal of this state shall permit a party or witness residing outside this state to be deposed or to testify under penalty of perjury by telephone, audiovisual means, or other electronic means at a designated tribunal or other location.  A tribunal of this state shall cooperate with other tribunals in designating an appropriate location for the deposition or testimony.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(7): If a party called to testify at a civil hearing refuses to answer on the ground that the testimony may be self-incriminating, the trier of fact may draw an adverse inference from the refusal.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(8): A privilege against disclosure of communications between spouses does not apply in a proceeding under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(9): The defense of immunity based on the relationship of husband and wife or parent and child does not apply in a proceeding under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-316(10): A voluntary acknowledgment of paternity, certified as a true copy, is admissible to establish parentage of the child.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-317 Communications between tribunals.
------------------------------------------------------------------
A tribunal of this state may communicate with a tribunal outside this state in a record, or by telephone, electronic mail, or other means, to obtain information concerning the laws, the legal effect of a judgment, decree, or order of that tribunal, and the status of a proceeding.  A tribunal of this state may furnish similar information by similar means to a tribunal outside this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-318 Assistance with discovery.
-----------------------------------------------------------
A tribunal of this state may:Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-318(1): request a tribunal outside this state to assist in obtaining discovery; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-318(2): upon request, compel a person over whom it has jurisdiction to respond to a discovery order issued by a tribunal outside this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-319 Receipt and disbursement of payments.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-319(1): A support enforcement agency or tribunal of this state shall disburse promptly any amounts received pursuant to a support order, as directed by the order.  The agency or tribunal shall furnish to a requesting party or tribunal of another state or a foreign country a certified statement by the custodian of the record of the amounts and dates of all payments received.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-319(2): If neither the obligor, nor the obligee who is an individual, nor the child resides in this state, upon request from the support enforcement agency of this state or another state, the Office of Recovery Services or a tribunal of this state shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-319(2)(a): direct that the support payment be made to the support enforcement agency in the state in which the obligee is receiving services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-319(2)(b): issue and send to the obligor's employer a conforming income-withholding order or an administrative notice of change of payee, reflecting the redirected payments.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-319(3): (2) The support enforcement agency of this state receiving redirected payments from another state pursuant to a law similar to Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(1)(b): the support enforcement agency seeking the order is located outside this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(2): Title 78B, Chapter 15, Part 3, Voluntary Declaration of Paternity Act The tribunal may issue a temporary child support order if the tribunal determines that an order is appropriate and the individual ordered to pay is:

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(2)(b): petitioning to have his paternity adjudicated;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(2)(c): identified as the father of the child through genetic testing;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(2)(d): an alleged father who has declined to submit to genetic testing;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(2)(e): shown by clear and convincing evidence to be the father of the child;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(2)(f): Title 78B, Chapter 15, Part 3, Voluntary Declaration of Paternity Act an acknowledged father determined in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(2)(g): the mother of the child; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(2)(h): an individual who has been ordered to pay child support in a previous proceeding and the order has not been reversed or vacated.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-401(3): 78B-14-305 Upon finding, after notice and opportunity to be heard, that an obligor owes a duty of support, the tribunal shall issue a support order directed to the obligor and may issue other orders pursuant to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-402 Proceeding to determine parentage.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
A tribunal of this state authorized to determine parentage of a child may serve as a responding tribunal in a proceeding to determine parentage brought under this chapter or a law or procedure substantially similar to this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-501 Employer's receipt of income-withholding order of another state.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An income-withholding order issued in another state may be sent by or on behalf of the obligee, or by the support-enforcement agency, to the person defined as the obligor's employer under

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502 Employer's compliance with income-withholding order of another state.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(1): Upon receipt of an income-withholding order, the obligor's employer shall immediately provide a copy of the order to the obligor.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(2): The employer shall treat an income-withholding order issued in another state which appears regular on its face as if it had been issued by a tribunal of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(3): (4); 78B-14-503 Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(3)(a): the duration and amount of periodic payments of current child support, stated as a sum certain;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(3)(b): the person designated to receive payments and the address to which the payments are to be forwarded;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(3)(c): medical support, whether in the form of periodic cash payment, stated as a sum certain, or ordering the obligor to provide health insurance coverage for the child under a policy available through the obligor's employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(3)(d): the amount of periodic payments of fees and costs for a support-enforcement agency, the issuing tribunal, and the obligee's attorney, stated as sums certain; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(3)(e): the amount of periodic payments of arrearages and interest on arrearages, stated as sums certain.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(4): An employer shall comply with the law of the state of the obligor's principal place of employment for withholding from income with respect to:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(4)(a): the employer's fee for processing an income withholding order;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(4)(b): the maximum amount permitted to be withheld from the obligor's income; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-502(4)(c): the times within which the employer must implement the withholding order and forward the child support payment.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-503 Employer's compliance with two or more income-withholding orders.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If an obligor's employer receives two or more income-withholding orders with respect to the earnings of the same obligor, the employer satisfies the terms of the multiple orders if the employer complies with the law of the state of the obligor's principal place of employment to establish the priorities for the withholding and allocating income withheld for two or more child support obligees.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-504 Immunity from civil liability.
---------------------------------------------------------------
An employer that complies with an income withholding order issued in another state in accordance with this part is not subject to civil liability to an individual or agency with regard to the employer's withholding of child support from the obligor's income.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-505 Penalties for noncompliance.
-------------------------------------------------------------
An employer that willfully fails to comply with an income withholding order issued in another state and received for enforcement is subject to the same penalties that may be imposed for noncompliance with an order issued by a tribunal of this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-506 Contest by obligor.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-506(1): Part 6, Registration, Enforcement, and Modification of Support Order An obligor may contest the validity or enforcement of an income-withholding order issued in another state and received directly by an employer in this state by registering the order in a tribunal of this state and filing a contest to that order as provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-506(2): The obligor shall give notice of the contest to:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-506(2)(a): a support-enforcement agency providing services to the obligee;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-506(2)(b): each employer that has directly received an income-withholding order relating to the obligor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-506(2)(c): the person designated to receive payments in the income-withholding order or if no person is designated, to the obligee.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-507 Administrative enforcement of orders.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-507(1): A party or support enforcement agency seeking to enforce a support order or an income-withholding order, or both, issued in another state, or seeking to enforce a foreign support order, may send the documents required for registering the order to a support enforcement agency of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-507(2): Upon receipt of the documents, the support enforcement agency, without initially seeking to register the order, shall consider and, if appropriate, use any administrative procedure authorized by the law of this state to enforce a support order or an income-withholding order, or both.  If the obligor does not contest administrative enforcement, the order need not be registered.  If the obligor contests the validity or administrative enforcement of the order, the support enforcement agency shall register the order pursuant to this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-601 Registration of order for enforcement.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
A support order or income-withholding order issued in another state, or a foreign support order, may be registered in this state for enforcement.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-602(3): A petition or comparable pleading seeking a remedy that shall be affirmatively sought under law of this state may be filed at the same time as the request for registration or later.  The pleading shall specify the grounds for the remedy sought.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-602(4): If two or more orders are in effect, the person requesting registration shall:

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-602(5): A request for a determination of which is the controlling order may be filed separately or with a request for registration and enforcement or for registration and modification.  The person requesting registration shall give notice of the request to each party whose rights may be affected by the determination.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-603 Effect of registration for enforcement.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-603(1): A support order or income-withholding order issued in another state, or a foreign support order, is registered when the order is filed in the registering tribunal of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-603(2): A registered support order issued in another state or a foreign country is enforceable in the same manner and is subject to the same procedures as an order issued by a tribunal of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-603(3): Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, a tribunal of this state shall recognize and enforce, but may not modify, a registered support order if the issuing tribunal had jurisdiction.


Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-604 Choice of law.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-604(1): (4) Except as otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-604(1)(a): the nature, extent, amount, and duration of current payments under a registered support order;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-604(1)(b): the computation and payment of arrearages and accrual of interest on the arrearages under the support order; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-604(1)(c): the existence and satisfaction of other obligations under the support order.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-604(2): In a proceeding for arrears under a registered support order, the statute of limitation of this state or of the issuing state or foreign country, whichever is longer, applies.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-604(3): A responding tribunal of this state shall apply the procedures and remedies of this state to enforce current support and collect arrears and interest due on a support order of another state or a foreign country registered in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-604(4): After a tribunal of this or another state determines which is the controlling order and issues an order consolidating arrears, if any, a tribunal of this state shall prospectively apply the law of the state or foreign country issuing the controlling order, including its law on interest on arrears, on current and future support, and on consolidated arrears.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-608 Confirmed order.
-------------------------------------------------
Confirmation of a registered support order, whether by operation of law or after notice and hearing, precludes further contest of the order with respect to any matter that could have been asserted at the time of registration.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-612 Recognition of order modified in another state.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a child support order issued by a tribunal of this state is modified by a tribunal of another state that assumed jurisdiction pursuant to the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act, a tribunal of this state:Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-612(1): may enforce its order that was modified only as to arrears and interest accruing before the modification;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-612(2): may provide appropriate relief for violations of its order which occurred before the effective date of the modification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-612(3): shall recognize the modifying order of the other state, upon registration, for the purpose of enforcement.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-614 Notice to issuing tribunal of modification.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Within 30 days after issuance of a modified child support order, the party obtaining the modification shall file a certified copy of the order with the issuing tribunal that had continuing, exclusive jurisdiction over the earlier order, and in each tribunal in which the party knows the earlier order has been registered.  A party who obtains the order and fails to file a certified copy is subject to appropriate sanctions by a tribunal in which the issue of failure to file arises.  The failure to file does not affect the validity or enforceability of the modified order of the new tribunal having continuing, exclusive jurisdiction.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5 Definitions.
-----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(1): "Application" means a request under the convention by an obligee or obligor, or on behalf of a child, made through a central authority for assistance from another central authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(2): 78B-14-102(5)(d) "Central authority" means the entity designated by the United States or a foreign country described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(3): 78B-14-102(5)(d) "Convention support order" means a support order of a tribunal of a foreign country described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(4): "Direct request" means a petition filed by an individual in a tribunal of this state in a proceeding involving an obligee, obligor, or child residing outside the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(5): 78B-14-102(5)(d) "Foreign central authority" means the entity designated by a foreign country described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(6): "Foreign support agreement":
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(6)(a): means an agreement for support in a record that:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(6)(a)(i): is enforceable as a support order in the country of origin;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(6)(a)(ii): has been:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(6)(a)(ii)(A): formally drawn up or registered as an authentic instrument by a foreign tribunal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(6)(a)(ii)(B): authenticated by, or concluded, registered, or filed with a foreign tribunal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(6)(a)(iii): may be reviewed and modified by a foreign tribunal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(6)(b): includes a maintenance arrangement or authentic instrument under the convention.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-701.5(7): "United States central authority" means the Secretary of the United States Department of Health and Human Services.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-703 Relationship of Department of Health and Human Services to United States central authority.

The Utah Department of Health and Human Services is recognized as the agency designated by the United States central authority to perform specific functions under the convention.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-705 Direct request.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-705(1): A petitioner may file a direct request seeking establishment or modification of a support order or determination of parentage of a child.  In the proceeding, the law of this state applies.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-705(3)(b): an obligee or obligor that in the issuing country has benefitted from free legal assistance is entitled to benefit, at least to the same extent, from any free legal assistance provided for by the law of this state under the same circumstances.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-705(4): A petitioner filing a direct request is not entitled to assistance from the Department of Human Services.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-705(5): This part does not prevent the application of laws of this state that provide simplified, more expeditious rules regarding a direct request for recognition and enforcement of a foreign support order or foreign support agreement.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-706(2)(b): a record stating that the support order is enforceable in the issuing country;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-706(2)(c): if the respondent did not appear and was not represented in the proceedings in the issuing country, a record attesting, as appropriate, either that the respondent had proper notice of the proceedings and an opportunity to be heard or that the respondent had proper notice of the support order and an opportunity to be heard in a challenge or appeal on fact or law before a tribunal;
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-706(2)(d): a record showing the amount of arrears, if any, and the date the amount was calculated;

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-706(2)(f): if necessary, a record showing the extent to which the applicant received free legal assistance in the issuing country.
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-706(3): A request for registration of a convention support order may seek recognition and partial enforcement of the order.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-709 Partial enforcement.
-----------------------------------------------------
If a tribunal of this state does not recognize and enforce a convention support order in its entirety, it shall enforce any severable part of the order.  An application or direct request may seek recognition and partial enforcement of a convention support order.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-711 Modification of convention child support order.

Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-711(1): A tribunal of this state may not modify a convention child support order if the obligee remains a resident of the foreign country where the support order was issued unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 78B-14-711(1)(a): the obligee submits to the jurisdiction of a tribunal of this state, either expressly or by defending on the merits of the case without objecting to the jurisdiction at the first available opportunity; or
